intro: Dalbergia elegans, commonly known as the elegant legume, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in racemes, which are followed by flat, pod-like fruits. Dalbergia elegans is often found in open woodlands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
